post.content:
Rumors circulating on the present time stemming from per week-used news liberate indicate Japanese entertainment conglomerate Konami has shut down its video gaming division. Konami assures us it has not.

In a news liberate dated January 15 the Japanese firm announced the dissolution of its three production divisions, along with workers strikes for workers previously in tag of production departments. What’s going down in that announcement, in step with an official commentary given to Kotaku by Konami, is true a consolidation of departments.

The commentary reads “The announcement made refers to an interior restructure, with Production Divisions being consolidated. We now have not shut down our video gaming division.”

So no worries, Konami will proceed to build that PES soccer sport and whatever else it does for the time being. Yu-Gi-Oh and such.
post.title: Konami Has Not Shut Down Its Video Gaming Division
